name: E3-2 Respiratory Protection
intro: The learning document for this test is at E3-2 Respiratory Protection in the FENZ Portal (requires to login with your FENZ account)

structure.description: Firefighters must don BA before entering a structure to investigate a fire, when must firefighters start up their BA?
options: As soon as they start to smell any smoke
Whenever they are operating in conditions that may expose them to a contaminated atmosphere
Other atmospheres that are irrespirable (e.g. depleted oxygen)
On the instruction of the Pump Operator
As soon as they have entered the building
correctAnswer: Whenever they are operating in conditions that may expose them to a contaminated atmosphere
Other atmospheres that are irrespirable (e.g. depleted oxygen)

structure.description: What equipment must all appliances that carry BA sets also carry?
options: At least 1 BA Main Guide Line
correctAnswer: At least 1 BA Main Guide Line

structure.description: Which pieces of equipment must all BA sets have?
The Entry Control Officer (ECO) is responsible for controlling the entry and exit of BA wearers into a hot zone, what other tasks is the ECO responsible for?
options: Monitoring the safety of BA wearers
Tasking and deploying emergency teams as required
Ensuring there is a response to any emergency involving BA wearers
Recommissioning BA sets ready for use
correctAnswer: Monitoring the safety of BA wearers
Tasking and deploying emergency teams as required

structure.description: Which of these would be a requirement for Stage 2 BA Control ?
options: More than 2 Entry Control Points are set up
There are 16 personnel or more on the incident ground
Six or more BA Teams are operating at the same time
There are multiple persons reported missing
correctAnswer: More than 2 Entry Control Points are set up
Six or more BA Teams are operating at the same time

structure.description:
In order to avoid leaks around the face mask seal a BA wearer must :
• not grow facial hair around the area of the mask seal.
• not wear glasses that pass through the mask seal .
• comply with manufacturers instructions.
• comply with AS/NZS 1715:2009, (Selection, Use and Maintenance of Respiratory Protective Devices).
